intro: Trichera arvensis var. agrestis, commonly known as the field trichera, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent.
